srcnet-oper

Command line utilities to interface with SRCNet APIs.

usage: srcnet-oper [-h] [-c C] [--debug] [--json] {api,config,data,metadata,service,storage,token} ...

Positional Arguments

command

Possible choices: api, config, data, metadata, service, storage, token

Named Arguments

-c

path to configuration file

Default: [‘etc/srcnet-clients-config.yml’, ‘/usr/local/etc/srcnet-clients-config.yml’]

--debug

debug mode

Default: False

--json

output as json

Default: False

Sub-commands

api

API operations

srcnet-oper api [-h] {health,ls,ping} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: health, ls, ping

API operations

Sub-commands

health

Get the API health

srcnet-oper api health [-h] service
Positional Arguments
service

The service name

ls

List APIs

srcnet-oper api ls [-h]
ping

Ping the API

srcnet-oper api ping [-h] service
Positional Arguments
service

The service name

config

Configuration file operations

srcnet-oper config [-h] {get} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: get

Configuration file operations

Sub-commands

get

Get a configuration file

srcnet-oper config get [-h] [--section SECTION]
Named Arguments
--section

Configuration file section to return

data

Data operations

srcnet-oper data [-h] {ls,namespace} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: ls, namespace

Data operations

Sub-commands

ls

List data identifiers in a namespace

srcnet-oper data ls [-h] --namespace NAMESPACE [--name NAME] [--detail] [--filters FILTERS] [--limit LIMIT]
Named Arguments
--namespace

The data namespace

--name

The data identifier name (wildcards allowed)

Default: “*”

--detail

More detail?

Default: False

--filters

Filters (Rucio only)

--limit

Number of identifiers to return in result

Default: 100

namespace

Data namespace operations

srcnet-oper data namespace [-h] {ls} ...
Positional Arguments
subsubcommand

Possible choices: ls

Data namespace operations

Sub-commands
ls

List namespaces

srcnet-oper data namespace ls [-h]

metadata

Metadata operations

srcnet-oper metadata [-h] {get,set} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: get, set

Metadata operations

Sub-commands

get

Get metadata for a data identifier

srcnet-oper metadata get [-h] --namespace NAMESPACE --name NAME [--store STORE] [--showempty]
Named Arguments
--namespace

The data identifier’s namespace

--name

The data identifier’s name

--store

The metadata store to use

Default: “file”

--showempty

Show empty keys?

Default: False

set

Set metadata for a data identifier

srcnet-oper metadata set [-h] --namespace NAMESPACE --name NAME --metadata METADATA
Named Arguments
--namespace

The data identifier’s namespace

--name

The data identifier’s name

--metadata

Metadata to set (JSON)

service

Service operations

srcnet-oper service [-h] {ls} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: ls

Service operations

Sub-commands

ls

List services

srcnet-oper service ls [-h]

storage

Storage operations

srcnet-oper storage [-h] {ls} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: ls

Storage operations

Sub-commands

ls

List storages

srcnet-oper storage ls [-h]

token

Token operations

srcnet-oper token [-h] {exchange,get,ls,inspect,request} ...

Positional Arguments

subcommand

Possible choices: exchange, get, ls, inspect, request

Token operations

Sub-commands

exchange

Exchange an existing token for a different service

srcnet-oper token exchange [-h] service
Positional Arguments
service

The service name to exchange for

get

Get contents of an existing token

srcnet-oper token get [-h] service
Positional Arguments
service

The service name

ls

List existing tokens

srcnet-oper token ls [-h]
inspect

Inspect an existing token

srcnet-oper token inspect [-h] service
Positional Arguments
service

The service name

request

Request a new token

srcnet-oper token request [-h]
